results.citation: Malory, T. (2017). _Le morte d'Arthur_ (P. J. C. Field, Ed.). D. S. Brewer.
results.model_response:
═══════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════
CITATION #1
═══════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════

ORIGINAL:
Malory, T. (2017). _Le morte d'Arthur_ (P. J. C. Field, Ed.). D. S. Brewer.

SOURCE TYPE: Book (edited edition of a classic work)

VALIDATION RESULTS:

❌ Book title: Uses title case; APA 7 requires sentence case for book titles
   Should be: Malory, T. (2017). *Le morte d'arthur* (P. J. C. Field, Ed.). D. S. Brewer.

❌ Formatting: Underscores used instead of proper italics in APA reference list
   Should be: Use italics via formatting, not underscores  
   Correctly formatted: Malory, T. (2017). *Le morte d'arthur* (P. J. C. Field, Ed.). D. S. Brewer.

results.citation: O'Connor, J., & Smith, L. (2017). _Nancy Clancy, late-breaking news!_ (R. Preiss Glasser, Illus.). HarperCollins Publishers.
results.model_response:
═══════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════
CITATION #1
═══════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════

ORIGINAL:
O'Connor, J., & Smith, L. (2017). _Nancy Clancy, late-breaking news!_ (R. Preiss Glasser, Illus.). HarperCollins Publishers.

SOURCE TYPE: Book

VALIDATION RESULTS:

❌ Title: Uses italics via underscores instead of proper formatting
   Should be: Nancy Clancy, late-breaking news! (in italics, not shown here as underscores)

❌ Illustrator notation: Non‑standard wording and placement
   - APA 7 allows indicating an illustrator in parentheses after the title, but uses “Illus.” or “Illustrated by” consistently and typically without initials formatting inside the parenthetical.
   A clearer APA 7–compliant version would be:
   Should be: O'Connor, J., & Smith, L. (2017). *Nancy Clancy, late-breaking news!* (Illustrated by R. Preiss Glasser). HarperCollins Publishers.

(If your instructor or style guide prefers initials retained, this can be: (R. Preiss Glasser, Illustrator). The key is consistent role wording and clear indication that this is an illustration credit, not an editor or translator.)

results.citation: joachimr., & smithj. (2019, November 19). We are relying on APA as our university style format - the university is located in Germany (Kassel). So I [Comment on the blog post "The transition to seventh edition APA Style"]. _APA Style_. https://apastyle.apa.org/blog/transition-seventh-edition#comment-4694866690
results.model_response:
═══════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════
CITATION #1
═══════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════

ORIGINAL:
joachimr., & smithj. (2019, November 19). We are relying on APA as our university style format - the university is located in Germany (Kassel). So I [Comment on the blog post "The transition to seventh edition APA Style"]. _APA Style_. https://apastyle.apa.org/blog/transition-seventh-edition#comment-4694866690

SOURCE TYPE: webpage (comment on a blog post)

VALIDATION RESULTS:

❌ Authors: Incorrect name formatting and capitalization
   - Names are lowercase and appear as usernames, not in LastName, Initials. format.
   - In APA, if only a username is available, capitalize it as a proper name and keep it as given (no invented last/first split, no period after a single username).
   Should be something like:
   Joachimr. (2019, November 19). ...
   or, if *both* are clearly authors/commenters and you wish to list both:
   Joachimr. & Smithj. (2019, November 19). ...

❌ Title: Contains full sentence and bracketed description not in proper sentence case; punctuation around brackets is off
   - The title should usually be a concise description of the comment content followed by a bracketed descriptor, in sentence case.
   - The title should not end with a period immediately before the bracket; the period comes after the bracketed description.
   Should be, for example:
   We are relying on APA as our university style format [Comment on the blog post "The transition to seventh edition APA style"]

❌ Bracketed description: Inconsistent capitalization of blog post title within brackets
   - APA uses sentence case for titles, including within descriptive brackets.
   - "The transition to seventh edition APA Style" should be in sentence case: "The transition to seventh edition APA style".
   Should be:
   [Comment on the blog post "The transition to seventh edition APA style"]

❌ Website name: Incorrect formatting (underscores instead of italics; sentence case instead of title case)
   - APA 7 requires the website name in Title Case and italicized, without surrounding underscores.
   Should be:
   *APA Style*

❌ Date detail (minor issue): Month and day are acceptable for webpages, but you listed a specific calendar date for a **comment** on a blog post
   - This is acceptable if the comment itself has that date, but ensure it truly matches the comment date. Format itself is ok: (2019, November 19).

❌ Overall punctuation and spacing:
   - Remove the period after the title before the brackets.
   - Place a period after the bracketed description.
   - Ensure italics are only used for the website name, not for the bracketed description.
   A corrected structure (keeping your core information) would be:

   Should be (one-author example):
   Joachimr. (2019, November 19). We are relying on APA as our university style format [Comment on the blog post "The transition to seventh edition APA style"]. *APA Style*. https://apastyle.apa.org/blog/transition-seventh-edition#comment-4694866690

   Or, if treating both usernames as authors:
   Joachimr. & Smithj. (2019, November 19). We are relying on APA as our university style format [Comment on the blog post "The transition to seventh edition APA style"]. *APA Style*. https://apastyle.apa.org/blog/transition-seventh-edition#comment-4694866690

results.citation: _King James Bible_ (2017) King James Bible Online. https://www.kingjamesbibleonline.org/ (Original work published: 1769)
results.model_response:
═══════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════
CITATION #1
═══════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════

ORIGINAL:
_King James Bible_ (2017) King James Bible Online. https://www.kingjamesbibleonline.org/ (Original work published: 1769)

SOURCE TYPE: Book (classical work, online)

VALIDATION RESULTS:

❌ Author/Title position: The title is presented in italics as if it were the author and is not followed by a period before the year.
   Should be (no individual author; title as author):
   King James Bible. (2017). *King James Bible online*. https://www.kingjamesbibleonline.org/ (Original work published 1769)

❌ Title capitalization (website name): Website name should be in title case and italicized, but “online” should be capitalized as part of the proper name.
   Should be:
   *King James Bible Online*

❌ Punctuation in original date note: APA uses a comma before the year, not a colon, in the “Original work published” parenthetical.
   Should be:
   (Original work published 1769)

✅ URL format: 
   https:// used; no period after the URL (correct)

✅ No location for publisher:
   Publisher location omitted (correct)

A fully corrected APA 7 citation:

King James Bible. (2017). *King James Bible Online*. https://www.kingjamesbibleonline.org/ (Original work published 1769)

results.citation: Leitch, M. G., & Rushton, C. J. (Eds.). 2019. _A New Companion to Malory_. D. S. Brewer.
results.model_response:
═══════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════
CITATION #1
═══════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════

ORIGINAL:
Leitch, M. G., & Rushton, C. J. (Eds.). 2019. _A New Companion to Malory_. D. S. Brewer.

SOURCE TYPE: book (edited volume)

VALIDATION RESULTS:

❌ Year: Incorrect punctuation and placement
   Should be: (2019).
   Explanation: In APA 7, the year appears in parentheses immediately after the authors/editors, followed by a period.

❌ Editors: Order and punctuation not in standard position
   Should be: Leitch, M. G., & Rushton, C. J. (Eds.). (2019).  
   Explanation: The role designation (Eds.) follows the names in parentheses, then the year in its own set of parentheses.

❌ Book title: Markup/italics usage not in plain-text APA style
   Should be: *A new companion to Malory*.  
   Explanation: Book titles are italicized and in sentence case (only the first word and proper nouns capitalized). In plain text APA, use italics rather than underscores or quotation marks.

CORRECTED FULL CITATION (APA 7):

Leitch, M. G., & Rushton, C. J. (Eds.). (2019). *A new companion to Malory*. D. S. Brewer.
